content.title: Scheme Of Coaching & Allied For Scheduled Castes
content.department: Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare
content.details: To promote a more level playing field, and give Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates a better chance to succeed in competitive examinations, the Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare has launched a scheme for coaching and pre examination training for disadvantaged SC candidates in quality coaching institutions to enable them to appear in competitive examinations and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job in the public/private sector.
benefits: The students will be given stipend of Rs.1000/- fixed per month for the entire period of coaching.
Financial assistance for boarding and lodging to outstation students @ Rs.2000/- per month per student.
eligibility: Should belong to Scheduled Caste (SC) category.
Should be a resident of Jharkhand.
Should have the eligible qualifications for the mentioned competitive exams.
The income ceiling of candidate should not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/- per annum.
content.application_process: For Institute: Take printout of all the forms and annexures from the scheme guideline and fill properly. The application form and all annexures should be properly indexed and submitted to the Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare.
documents_required: Audited accounts for last three years.
Results of last three years (with grading) vis-à-vis intake.
Details of Faculty and their academic/professional qualification.
Confirmation by concerned Deputy Commissioner regarding genuineness of institution.
Surety Bond signed by the full Executive Committee.
The undertaking by the institution that it has not received grant for the same purpose from any other Department.
Results in the prescribed format of the SC candidates given coaching under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme is to provide coaching and pre examination training for disadvantaged SC candidates in quality coaching institutions.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare, Jharkhand.

faqs.question: Who will be covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Registered Private Coaching Institutions/ NGO’s running their centre in the State of Jharkhand shall be covered under the scheme.

faqs.question: What will be the duration of this grant?
faqs.answer: The coaching institutions will be selected for the course period only in a financial year.

faqs.question: What is the income criteria for the SC candidates?
faqs.answer: The income ceiling of candidates under the scheme will be ₹ 2,50,000/- per annum.
